Key Match Events: Ross Adair scored a 57-ball hundred, Ireland's third century in the format.
Mark Adair took 4 for 31 to seal the win.
South Africa needed 108 off the last 10 overs, with nine wickets in hand, and 53 off the last five overs, with seven wickets in the bank, and that is when Mark Adair struck.
South Africa needed 23 runs off the last 12, and Mark Adair sent down a slower ball to Mulder, who hit straight up and Adair completed the catch.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland won by 10 runs, their first T20I win against South Africa and second overall against them in internationals.
Post-Match Reflections: Ross Adair expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland posted their highest total against South Africa and successfully defended it in Abu Dhabi.
Ross Adair should have been out not once, but five times during his innings.
South Africa gave away only 19 runs in the last three overs to keep Ireland under 200.
